meanings.definition: Instigate or stir up (an undesirable or violent sentiment or course of action)
meanings.sent1: The troublemaker was fomenting trouble among the students by spreading rumors.
meanings.sent2: The politician was accused of fomenting unrest in the city through his provocative speeches.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was fomenting chaos in the park by stealing everyone's snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a match fomenting a fire of rebellion in the hearts of the oppressed.
meanings.sent5: The sinister character in the story had a talent for fomenting discord wherever he went.

meanings.definition: Apply warm liquid or medication to the surface of the skin
meanings.sent1: After the burn, the nurse began fomenting the affected area with a soothing ointment.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's coach recommended fomenting his sore muscles with a heating pad.
meanings.sent3: The spa offered a luxurious treatment of fomenting the body with fragrant oils.
meanings.sent4: The grandmother believed in the healing power of fomenting with herbal remedies.
meanings.sent5: The traditional remedy involved fomenting the forehead with a damp cloth to reduce fever.
